get_info_and_historic

Source: vignettes/get_info_and_historic.Rmd
get_info_and_historic.Rmd

This vignette show how to fetch data from company names and get historic financial data from Yahoo API.

library(financr)

Fetch ticker symbols associated with keyword(s) such as companies names, and get historical financial data for these symbols.

# 1) fetch_indices (optionally filter a precise marketplace)
indices <- get_info_from_name(names = c("VOLVO", "RENAULT")
                         , exchange = "STO")
# Keep only the swedish exchange place (STOckholm)

# 2) Fetch historical values, given ticker symbol(s)
datas <- get_historic(symbols = indices$symbol)
#>   VOLCAR-B.ST [OK]                                                                                                      VOLV-B.ST [OK]                                                                                                      VOLV-A.ST [OK]                                                                                                    

str(datas)
#> 'data.frame':    1530 obs. of  14 variables:
#>  $ open            : num  19.3 19.1 19.1 19.1 19.1 ...
#>  $ close           : num  19.2 19.1 19.1 19.1 19.1 ...
#>  $ low             : num  19.1 19.1 19 19.1 19.1 ...
#>  $ high            : num  19.3 19.3 19.1 19.2 19.1 ...
#>  $ volume          : int  0 77370 15211 18321 3056 127294 7152 21962 5421 8115 ...
#>  $ timestamp       : int  1743490800 1743490860 1743490920 1743490980 1743491040 1743491100 1743491160 1743491220 1743491280 1743491340 ...
#>  $ date            : POSIXct, format: "2025-04-01 09:00:00" "2025-04-01 09:01:00" ...
#>  $ currency        : chr  "SEK" "SEK" "SEK" "SEK" ...
#>  $ symbol          : chr  "VOLCAR-B.ST" "VOLCAR-B.ST" "VOLCAR-B.ST" "VOLCAR-B.ST" ...
#>  $ shortname       : chr  "Volvo Car AB ser. B" "Volvo Car AB ser. B" "Volvo Car AB ser. B" "Volvo Car AB ser. B" ...
#>  $ longname        : chr  "Volvo Car AB (publ.)" "Volvo Car AB (publ.)" "Volvo Car AB (publ.)" "Volvo Car AB (publ.)" ...
#>  $ exchangename    : chr  "STO" "STO" "STO" "STO" ...
#>  $ fullexchangename: chr  "Stockholm" "Stockholm" "Stockholm" "Stockholm" ...
#>  $ timezone        : chr  "CEST" "CEST" "CEST" "CEST" ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 1
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr "SEK"
#>  - attr(*, "date")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-04-02"
#>  - attr(*, "crypto")= logi FALSE

If you need to, see what are these currencies with financr::get_currencies().


unknown_currencies <- unique(datas$currency)

explaination <- get_currencies(unknown_currencies)

head(explaination)
#>    shortname      longname symbol locallongname
#> 36       SEK Swedish Krona    SEK Swedish Krona

See how to convert it to another currency such as ‘USD’ with the Vignette of get_changes() and get_currencies().
